title-part.text: LAUNCHING, HAULING-OUT, OR DRY-DOCKING OF VESSELS
EQUIPMENT FOR DWELLING OR WORKING UNDER WATER
MEANS FOR SALVAGING OR SEARCHING FOR UNDERWATER OBJECTS

reference.text: floating nets, floating slipways, or the like for recovering aircraft from the water B63B35/52

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the indexing codes B63B2201/00 - B63B2241/00 are to be used for relevant technical information concerning particular or unusual use, materials, design, methods or means.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

Groups B63C1/00 - B63C15/00 are incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups B63B2701/00 - B63B2770/00.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Bladder restrictors, i.e. mechanical means, other than peripheral or circumferential means, for restricting expansion in inflated state of inflatable bladders or chambers, e.g. welded spots or lines, or internal braces for limiting thickness
characterised by making use of shark deterrents, e.g. electric, acoustic, mechanical or chemical means for deterring sharks

CPC-specific-text.text: Underwater equipment specially adapted for use by animals, e.g. diving helmets for dogs
Diving computers, i.e. portable computers specially adapted for divers, e.g. wrist worn, watertight electronic devices for detecting or calculating scuba diving parameters
for facilitating observation of objects in opaque liquids, e.g. in dirty, turbid or dark water
Accessories for diving arranged or for use outside the water
Tank racks, i.e. racks or mountings for storing breathing air tanks, e.g. onboard boats

Diving harnesses, or the like, e.g. for carrying breathing air tanks
Shells for diving equipment, i.e. substantially rigid housings or covers, e.g. streamlined shells
